intro: Brodiaea crocea var. modesta, commonly known as the Modest Brodiaea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to California. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, preferring full sun. It is part of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other bulbous plants. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to gardens.
